item.title: A-level results: 'Huge mess' as exams appeal guidance withdrawn
item.description: The criteria for "valid" mock exams is being reviewed by the regulator, hours after it published it.

item.title: Four young men die as car crashes into house near Chippenham
item.description: Police said the victims, some in their late teens, died at the scene of the crash in Wiltshire.

item.title: Bodies found in Lancashire sea search for missing Dewsbury brothers
item.description: The teenage boys, aged 16 and 18, got into difficulty while swimming with their cousin in Lancashire.

item.title: Coronavirus: Public Health England 'to be replaced'
item.description: Health Secretary Matt Hancock is to announce a new body this week, according to the Sunday Telegraph.

item.title: Coronavirus: 'Reckless scenes' at Dublin venue criticised
item.description: Footage shows a man at the venue standing on a bar pouring alcohol into the mouths of people below.

item.title: The Crown: Elizabeth Debicki to play Princess Diana in final series
item.description: The Australian actress will take over from Emma Corrin for the final two seasons of the Netflix show.

item.title: MSC Grandiosa: First Mediterranean cruise launches after five-month pause
item.description: Operator MSC Cruises says everyone aboard has been tested for coronavirus amid safety concerns.

item.title: New Zealand: Jacinda Ardern delays election over coronavirus fears
item.description: Jacinda Ardern has postponed September's election until October following new coronavirus cases.

item.title: Lake District rubbish 'makes me want to cry'
item.description: A charity describes mounds of discarded camping equipment and litter as heartbreaking.

item.title: Woman held over death of 10-year-old in Acton, west London
item.description: She spoke to police in the early hours and shortly after he was found dead at a home in west London.

item.title: Sevilla end Man Utd's Europa League hopes
item.description: Sevilla end Manchester United's hopes of a trophy this season as they come from behind to win the Europa League semi-final 2-1 in Cologne.

item.title: World Snooker Championship 2020: Ronnie O'Sullivan wins sixth world title
item.description: Ronnie O'Sullivan claims his sixth World Championship title and a record 37th ranking event with a dominant 18-8 victory over Kyren Wilson in Sheffield.

item.title: Dover Harbour closed to swimmers as E. coli levels rise
item.description: One woman says she, her husband and her friends became unwell shortly after visiting Dover Harbour.

item.title: The Papers: 'Pupil power', and PM told to end exams 'shambles'
item.description: Several of Monday's papers are dominated by the rolling controversy surrounding A-level results.

item.title: Penguin waddling in Broxtowe picked up by police
item.description: The officers were surprised to see the aquatic bird in landlocked Nottinghamshire.

item.title: Blood cancer, my baby and me
item.description: Within a single month Máirín Geddis turned 30 years old, gave birth and was diagnosed with cancer.

item.title: The black women in tech coding the future
item.description: The Black Codher Bootcamp, the first of its kind, will train 50 women to become software developers.

item.title: Your pictures: Scotland's staycation summer
item.description: A selection of your pictures taken on your summer staycations across Scotland.

item.title: Coronavirus: Memorial gardens planned across England
item.description: World War One changed the way we honour war dead, will coronavirus do the same for victims of pandemics?

item.title: Campaigners win fight to stop Maldives islands becoming luxury resort
item.description: Local residents in the Maldives have won a campaign against developers and the government who wanted to turn two islands into a luxury resort.

item.title: Rising water levels in Kenya's Great Rift Valley threaten jobs and wildlife
item.description: Thousands of people have been forced out of their homes by rising water levels in two Kenyan lakes.

item.title: Prosopagnosia: The artist in search of her face
item.description: Carlotta is a prolific self portrait artist from Munich with prosopagnosia - face blindness.

item.title: Belarus protests: 'We can breathe for the first time in our lives'
item.description: After 26 years of President Lukashenko's rule, there is a sense of euphoria among protesters.

item.title: Egypt Facebook page raises hopes for missing children
item.description: After years searching in vain, a father's nightmare is brought to an end using an unlikely source.

item.title: Democratic National Convention: What to watch for at Biden's nomination party
item.description: Covid may have spoiled the party in Wisconsin, but there's still a lot you need to know about the virtual event.

item.title: Spree: The Drake-produced 'takedown' of attention-seeking violence
item.description: Stranger Things' Joe Keery stars as a taxi driver who resorts to desperate measures for internet fame.

item.title: 'People are hungry for new music after lockdown'
item.description: The music industry nearly ground to a halt as the pandemic gripped the UK, so how have companies coped?

item.title: Dropshipping: The hustlers making millions from goods they never handle
item.description: Dropshippers buy cheap products from China and then pay internet celebrities to promote them.

item.title: Coronavirus: Vicar's story of shock and grief in Cardiff parish
item.description: How the shock and pressure of the pandemic has had an enormous impact on a city suburb.

item.title: Hamilton dominates in Spain to claim fourth win in six races
item.description: Lewis Hamilton dominates the Spanish Grand Prix to take his fourth victory in six races so far this year.

item.title: Draw looms in second England-Pakistan Test after more rain
item.description: The second Test between England and Pakistan is set to end in a draw after more rain allows only an hour's play on day four at the Ageas Bowl.

item.title: Rangers' 100% record ends with goalless draw at Livingston
item.description: Livingston bring an end to Rangers' 100% Premiership record as Steven Gerrard's side miss the chance to go eight points clear of Celtic.

item.title: Ronnie O'Sullivan: Highlights as 'The Rocket' wins world title number six
item.description: Watch a recap of the best action and reactions from Ronnie O'Sullivan's 18-8 win over Kyren Wilson to seal his sixth World Championship title.

item.title: NBA play-offs: All you need to know about the first-round match-ups
item.description: The 2020 NBA play-offs begin on Monday after one of the most unusual seasons in the sport's history - here's BBC Sport's guide to what to look out for.

item.title: Ronnie O'Sullivan: Action and hairstyles from all six of The Rocket's world title wins - 2001-2020
item.description: Relive the winning moments and celebrations from all six of Ronnie O'Sullivan's snooker World Championship wins as he adds the 2020 title to his wins in 2001, 2004, 2008, 2012 and 2013.

item.title: Watch: MotoGP riders escape serious injury in 'terrifying' crash
item.description: MotoGP riders Franco Morbidelli and Johann Zarco crash spectacularly at the Austrian Grand Prix, with Valentino Rossi describing the collision as "terrifying".

item.title: Coronavirus: What are social distancing and self-isolation rules?
item.description: Social distancing and lockdown rules have been changing across the UK - what can you do now?

item.title: Coronavirus: Will schools fully reopen for the new term?
item.description: Schools are set to go back for the autumn term, but scientists say society may have to make trade-offs.

item.title: Coronavirus pandemic: Tracking the global outbreak
item.description: Key charts and maps explaining how the respiratory virus has spread around the world.

item.title: Europe lockdown: New coronavirus rules country by country
item.description: What are European countries doing to control new coronavirus outbreaks?

item.title: Coronavirus: What are the new lockdown rules for Preston and other areas?
item.description: Preston has become the latest place to impose restrictions. But how does a local lockdown work?

item.title: 'A Hinge date saved my life' and other cancer dating stories
item.description: Dating during lockdown is hard enough in 2020, but how do you deal with it when cancer is in the mix too?

item.title: How the pandemic is making male postnatal depression worse
item.description: Dave says the pandemic made his depression ''a million times worse than what it should've been''.

item.title: Newry boy has part of gut removed after swallowing magnets
item.description: The tiny ball magnets can cause life-threatening sepsis when lodged in a child's intestines.

item.title: Lightning pictures: Spectacular storms light up England skies
item.description: Photos from across England show a remarkable lightning show on a stormy Wednesday night.

item.title: Daft as a brush: Painters decorate eight homes by mistake
item.description: In three years Wayne Collins has managed to daub the wrong house seven times and Jack Tinkling once.
